findings.title: Approval racing condition
findings.description: The standard ERC20 implementation contains a widely-known racing condition in its approve function, wherein a spender is able to witness the token owner broadcast a transaction altering their approval, and quickly sign and broadcast a transaction using transferFrom to move the current approved amount from the owner's balance to the spender.

findings.title: VoteForCandidate() doesn't check if correlationID is correct or not
findings.description: The VoteForCandidate function does not verify the correctness of the correlationID, allowing voters to participate with an incorrect ID and resulting in token deductions from their account.

findings.title: Pausable Contract is not imported anywhere as well as not used
findings.description: The Pausable contract is declared but not utilized within the smart contract.

findings.title: Contract locking ether found in main contract using function depositGas()
findings.description: The payable function 'depositGas()' in the main contract locks Ether and there is no function to withdraw Ether from the contract.

findings.title: Unused Internal Function
findings.description: The isVoterInArray() function in the Voting contract is an internal function and is not called anywhere in the contract.

findings.title: Unused Modifiers in Voting Contract
findings.description: Modifiers declared on voting contract did not used with any function, which may lead to unnecessary storage cost.

findings.title: Reentrancy Issue in CreateBallot() Function
findings.description: The CreateBallot() function of Main contract at line 49 is having a Reentrancy Issue due to calling external functions and making state changes after these calls.

findings.title: External Call Risk in voteForCandidate() Function
findings.description: The voteForCandidate() function in the Voting contract is calling the payForServices() function of the Main contract, which can lead to state changes after external calls. This is risky and should be avoided.
